intro: Hypoxis pratensis var. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate yellowstar, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a dense cluster at the top of a short stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
